meanings.definition: A gift of personal property by will.
meanings.sent1: She received many bequests from her grandmother's will.
meanings.sent2: The lawyer read out the list of bequests in the will.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected bequests in the will made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: Her bequests were like hidden treasures waiting to be discovered.
meanings.sent5: The bequests in the will painted a picture of generosity.

meanings.sent1: The bequests were carried out according to the instructions in the will.
meanings.sent2: His bequests were a reflection of his kindness and thoughtfulness.
meanings.sent3: The bequests ceremony was filled with solemnity and respect.
meanings.sent4: The bequests flowed smoothly from one generation to the next.
meanings.sent5: The bequests symbolized the enduring bond between family members.

meanings.definition: Something that is bequeathed; a legacy.
meanings.sent1: The antique clock was a cherished bequest from her grandfather.
meanings.sent2: His bequests to the community left a lasting impact.
meanings.sent3: The bequests of wisdom from the elders were invaluable.
meanings.sent4: Her bequests of love and kindness enriched the lives of many.
meanings.sent5: The bequests of knowledge were passed down through the generations.
